result.execSummary:
The defendant Darnell Bankhead was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Retail Theft - Intentionally Take >$500 - $5000), a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.50(1m)(b).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

superMiscConds.notes: Costs to be paid as a condition of Extended Supervision.

Provide DNA Specimen unless previously obtained. Surcharge is imposed. 
  If Probation/Extended Supervision is revoked and/or a prison term ordered, outstanding financial obligations shall be collected pursuant to statutory provisions, including deductions from inmate prison monies.  If discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collections may include income assignment.

records.addlTxt: Transcript received and filed for the following date and event: Plea and Sentencing, held on September 28, 2015,  transcript held on 15CF228, filed by Cheryl Humpal, RPR
with Elements of criminal offenses to which plea is being entered.

Defendant Darnell  Bankhead in court, in custody, with Attorney M. Elizabeth Weathers.   Kristi J Gordon appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant enters a guilty plea to Count #1.  Court performs plea colloquy and finds Defendant guilty of Count #1.  Counts #2 & 3 are dismissed and read-in.  State gives sentencing recommendations.  Attorney Weathers makes statements regarding sentencing.  Defendant makes statements.  Court sentences the Defendant to the following:

COUNT #1:  IMPOSED SENTENCE OF:   

2 YEARS  IMPRISONMENT       **CONSECUTIVE TO PRESENT SENTENCE AND CASE #15CF229  
  -  1 YEAR OF INITIAL CONFINEMENT
  -  1 YEAR OF EXTENDED SUPERVISON 

CONDITIONS OF EXTENDED SUPERVISON:  
____DNA sample to be provided if not yet previously done


COSTS:  $278.00 & $250.00 DNA surcharge  (to be paid as a condition of extended supervision)

Defendant is not eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program.
Defendant is not eligible for the Substance Abuse Program.

Felony warnings, voting rights and firearms warnings given.

DEFENDANT TO BE RETURNED FORTHWITH
